title: Bg. 18.10
sanskrit: न द्वेष्ट्यकुशलं कर्म कुशले नानुषज्ज‍ते ।त्यागी सत्त्वसमाविष्टो मेधावी छिन्नसंशय: ॥ १० ॥
transliteration: na dveṣṭy akuśalaṁ karmakuśale nānuṣajjatetyāgī sattva-samāviṣṭomedhāvī chinna-saṁśayaḥ
literary_trans: The intelligent renouncer situated in the mode of goodness, neither hateful of inauspicious work nor attached to auspicious work, has no doubts about work.The intelligent renouncer situated in the mode of goodness, neither hateful of inauspicious work nor attached to auspicious work, has no doubts about work.PurportA person in Kṛṣṇa consciousness or in the mode of goodness does not hate anyone or anything which troubles his body. He does work in the proper place and at the proper time without fearing the troublesome effects of his duty. Such a person situated in transcendence should be understood to be most intelligent and beyond all doubts in his activities.
